alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern York , the City of Poquoson, the City of Hampton and the northern City of Newport News through 430 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Patrick Henry Field, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, Langley AFB, Seaford, Patrick Henry Field, Denbigh, Buckroe Beach, Tabb, Grand View, Fox Hill, Langley View, Oriana, Dare, Newport News Golf Course, Oyster Point, Messick, Hornsbyville, Harris Grove, Plum Tree Island Refuge and Yorktown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
